Exonerate.definition: to relieve esp. of a charge
Exonerate.origin: [Latin exonerare to relieve, free, discharge, from ex- out + onerare to burden, from oner- onus load]

-atÂ·ing.definition: [Latinto relieve, free, discharge, fromout +to burden, fromload]

1.definition: to relieve esp. of a charge, obligation, or hardship

2.definition: to clear from accusation or blame compare,
